org.eclipse.nvplayout.controller

Class MemoryConfigurationController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.nvplayout.controller.MemoryConfigurationController

  • public class MemoryConfigurationController
extends java.lang.Object
    MemoryConfigurationController is the controller to manage the global memory configuration model.

    Based on a MVC model

    Version:
    0.0 Alpha EarlyAccess Beta Tester
    Author:
    GLI feat Software Team
    See Also:
    MemoryConfiguration

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) MemoryConfiguration memoryConfiguration 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MemoryConfigurationController()
      Create the global structure of the global memory configuration, update the structure with the file GlobalConfiguration.xml

    • Method Detail

      • importData

        public void importData()
        Import the data from the GlobalConfiguration.xml file to the local Memory configuration model.
        See Also:
        readXML(org.w3c.dom.Node), SimpleErrorHandler

      • exportData

        public boolean exportData()
        Export the data present in local Memory Configuration model to the GlobalConfiguration.xml file.
        Returns:
        boolean : true if the xml file were successfully write, false if not
        See Also:
        writeXML(org.w3c.dom.Document)

      • getCalibrationAddress

        public long getCalibrationAddress()
        Return the address of the calibration section.
        Returns:
        Long : Address of the calibration section.
        See Also:

      • getStartAddress

        public java.lang.String[] getStartAddress()
        Return an array of address of each memory section.
        Returns:
        String[] : Array of address of each memory section. [CALIBRATION ADDRESS; RAM SHADOW ADDRESS; ROM ADDRESS; EEPROM ALIAS ADDRESS]
        See Also:
        MemoryConfiguration.getStartAddress()

      • getMemorySize

        public java.lang.String[] getMemorySize()
        Return an array of size of each memory section.
        Returns:
        String[] : Size of the calibration section. [CALIBRATION SIZE]
        See Also:
        MemoryConfiguration.getMemorySize()

      • getVersion

        public java.lang.String[] getVersion()
        Return an array of version of calibration section.
        Returns:
        String[] : Address of the calibration section. [MAJOR VERSION; MINOR VERSION; SUBVERSION]
        See Also:
        MemoryConfiguration.getVersion()

      • setDataDisplay

        public void setDataDisplay(int iDisplay)
        Set in which format the data is return.
        Parameters:
        iDisplay - Int : 0 = HEXADECIMALDISPLAY; 1 = DECIMALDISPLAY
        See Also:
        MemoryConfiguration.setDisplay(int)

      • setVersion

        public void setVersion(int versionType,
                       java.lang.String version)
        Set a new Version according the first parameter. Check the string version and change it to int one. Catch the error if the string is not align to possible one: decimal or hexadecimal with 0x.
        Parameters:
        versionType - Int : K_MAJORVERSION = 0 : K_MINORVERSION = 1 : K_SUBVERSION = 2
        version - Int : New version.
        See Also:
        MemoryConfiguration.setVersion(int, int)

      • setSize

        public void setSize(int sizeType,
                    java.lang.String size)
        Set a new memory size according the first parameter. Check the string size and change it to int one. Catch the error if the string is not align to possible one: decimal or hexadecimal with 0x.
        Parameters:
        sizeType - Int : K_CALIBRATIONSIZE = 0 : K_RAMSHADOWSIZE = 1 : K_ROMSIZE = 2
        size - String : New size.
        See Also:
        MemoryConfiguration.setSize(int, int)

      • setAddress

        public void setAddress(int addressType,
                       java.lang.String address)
        Set a new address according the first parameter. Check the string address and change it to int one. Catch the error if the string is not align to possible one: decimal or hexadecimal with 0x.
        Parameters:
        addressType - Int : K_CALIBRATIONADDRESS = 0 : K_RAMSHADOWADDRESS = 1 : K_ROMADDRESS = 2 : K_EEPROMALIASADDRESS = 3
        address - String : New Address.
        See Also:
        MemoryConfiguration.setaddress(int, long)

      • generatefile

        public boolean generatefile()
        Launch a batch file to generate the .c, .h and .s00 file according the .xml file
        Returns:
        Boolean : return true if the command is well executed, false if not.

      • readXML

        private void readXML(org.w3c.dom.Node n)
        Recursive function use to parse all the tag of the GlobalConfiguration.xml file. And set the data information in the local data base.
        Parameters:
        n - Node : The node contain all the information of there children; the first call need to be the root node of the GlobalConfiguration.xml file.
        See Also:
        MemoryConfiguration.setApplicationName(java.lang.String), MemoryConfiguration.setCalibrationAddress(long), MemoryConfiguration.setRAMShadowAddress(long), MemoryConfiguration.setROMAddress(long), MemoryConfiguration.setEepromAliasAddress(long), MemoryConfiguration.setMajorVersion(int), MemoryConfiguration.setMinorVersion(int), MemoryConfiguration.setSubversion(int), MemoryConfiguration.setCalibrationSize(int)

      • writeXML

        private void writeXML(org.w3c.dom.Document doc)
        Construct the xml tree for GlobalConfiguration.xml.
        Parameters:
        doc - Document : The xml tree, need to be empty at function call
        See Also:
        MemoryConfiguration.getApplicationName(), MemoryConfiguration.getCalibrationAddress(), MemoryConfiguration.getRAMShadowAddress(), MemoryConfiguration.getROMAddress(), MemoryConfiguration.getEepromAliasAddress(), MemoryConfiguration.getMajorVersion(), MemoryConfiguration.getMinorVersion(), MemoryConfiguration.getSubversion(), MemoryConfiguration.getCalibrationSize()
